The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.

What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?

Comments_List: Increased proficiency both speaking and writing.
Learned Modern Standard Arabic, grained, vocab, and speaking skills
Further improved reading, writing, and speaking skills in Modern Standard Arabic. Learned a lot of grammar.
The course effectively taught grammar and speaking skills without being too demanding. Additionally, the TA Friday speaking sessions were very helpful.
This course could use language tables to practice speaking and make more use of videos for students to hear the language.
It was very fast and hard for me to follow but still very interesting and fun

Professor Elbousty is extremely friendly and willing to help with any issue. It helped that he spoke a lot in Arabic and then clarified some in English to get our ears adjusted to spoken Arabic. Only focusing on MSA rather than on MSA and a dialect prevented confusion and laid a good foundation without becoming overwhelming.
I would recommend this course to another student if they were already committed to learning Arabic and were willing to do the extra work to learn what is not offered in the course.
Yes! If you are dedicated and want to learn Arabic this is a great course
If you are interested in learning Arabic, yes.
